title: Register in Authy: old users
name: Register_in_Authy
description: This method gets the response about update the phone information of the user and the registration in Authy application. An email will be sent to indicate the next steps for the user.

examples.title: Example usage
Obtain device id and information.

body.description: A json object with information about device id, timezone, platform and userAgent.

examples.title: Request-Example:

Success 200.description: If all goes well, the system should return "User Registered in Authy" and the token.

Failed 500.description:
Information about the request was failed:

    Error finding the user
    User not found
    Error finding the group
    Group not found
    Error registering the user in Authy
    Error updating the user
    Fail sending email

title: Get the token with 2FA
name: Request_approval
description:
This method gets the token and the language for the user with 2FA. This token includes the encrypt id of the user, token expiration date, role, and the group to which it belongs. The token are encoded using jwt

We use the fingerprintjs2 library for configuring the params.

examples.title: Example usage
Obtain device id and information.

body.description: timezone, platform and user Agent of the user device.

examples.title: Request-Example:

Success 200.description:
If the request is approved by the user: "You have successfully logged in"
    If the request is denied by the user "Authentication denied"

If the request is approved by the user - the unique token for the user access to Health29
    If the request is denied by the user: null

If the request is approved by the user - Lang of the User.
    If the request is denied by the user: null

Failed 500.description:
Some errors could return 500 error (specified in message field of the object result)

    {message: "Bad Request sending approval"}
    {message: "Bad Request for checking approval status"}
    {message: "User not found"}

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: Get the token (and the userId)
name: signIn
description:
This method gets the token and the language for the user. This token includes the encrypt id of the user, token expiration date, role, and the group to which it belongs. The token are encoded using jwt

The functionality of this method is directly related to the second authentication factor. That is, you have to take into account if the user you want to perform the operation with belongs or not to a patient group that has configured the 2FA.According to this, the answers obtained will be different. In this case, you will have to use the methods: Get token 2FA and Register in Authy.

We use the fingerprintjs2 library for configuring the params.

examples.title: Example for general usage
Example for users with 2FA
Obtain device id and information.
Request-Example:

Success 200.description: If all goes well, the system should return 'You have successfully logged in'

You will need this token in the header of almost all requests to the API. Whenever the user wants to access a protected route or resource, the user agent should send the JWT, in the Authorization header using the Bearer schema.

The data contained in the token are: encrypted userId, expiration token, group, and role. To decode them, you you must use some jwt decoder jwt. There are multiple options to do it, for example for javascript: Option 1 Option 2 When you decode, you will see that it has several values, these are:

  • sub: the encrypted userId. This value will also be used in many API queries. It is recommended to store only the token, and each time the userId is required, decode the token.
  • exp: The expiration time claim identifies the expiration time on or after which the JWT must not be accepted for processing.
  • group: Group to which the user belongs, if it does not have a group, it will be 'None'.
  • role: Role of the user. Normally it will be 'User'.

Success 200 UpdatePhone.description: Information that update phone information for the user is required: "Update Phone"

Success 202.description:
Information about the request. The credentials are incorrect or something has gone wrong. One of the following answers will be obtained:

  • Not found
  • Login failed
  • Account is temporarily locked
  • Account is unactivated

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: New password
name: newPass
description: This method allows you to change the password of an account. It is another way to change the password, but in this case, you need to provide the current and the new password, and it does not require validation through the mail account. In this case, it requires authentication in the header.

examples.title: Example usage:

Header.description: Users unique access-key. For this, go to Get token

body.description: User email. In the link to request a change of password sent to the email, there is an email parameter. The value of this parameter will be the one to be assigned to email.

Success 200.description: Information about the request. If everything went correctly, return 'password changed'

Success 202.description:
Information about the request. The credentials are incorrect or something has gone wrong. One of the following answers will be obtained:

  • Not found
  • Login failed (if the current password is incorrect)
  • Account is temporarily locked
  • Account is unactivated

title: Request password change
name: recoverPass
description: This method allows you to send a request to change the password. At the end of this call, you need to check the email account to call update password.

examples.title: Example usage:

Success 200.description: Information about the request. If everything went correctly, return 'Email sent'

Eror 500.description:
Information about the request. The credentials are incorrect or something has gone wrong. One of the following answers will be obtained:

  • Fail sending email
  • user not exists
  • account not activated

title: New account
name: signUp
description: This method allows you to create a user account in health 29

examples.title: Example usage:

body.description:
Lang of the User. For this, go to Get the available languages. We currently have 5 languages, but we will include more. The current languages are:

  • English: en
  • Spanish: es
  • German: de
  • Dutch: nl
  • Portuguese: pt
Group to which the user belongs, if it does not have a group or do not know the group to which belongs, it will be 'None'. If the group is not set, it will be set to 'None' by default.

Success 200.description:
Information about the request. One of the following answers will be obtained:

  • Account created (The user should check the email to activate the account)
  • Fail sending email
  • user exists

title: Update password
name: updatePass
description: This method allows you to change the password of an account. Before changing the password, you previously had to make a request for password change.

examples.title: Example usage:

body.description: User email. In the link to request a change of password sent to the email, there is an email parameter. The value of this parameter will be the one to be assigned to email.
In the password change request link sent to the email, there is a key parameter. The value of this parameter will be the one that must be assigned to randomCodeRecoverPass.

Success 200.description: Information about the request. If everything went correctly, return 'password changed'

Eror 500.description:
Information about the request. The credentials are incorrect or something has gone wrong. One of the following answers will be obtained:

  • invalid link
  • link expired (The link has expired after more than 15 minutes since you requested it. Re-request a password change.)
  • Account is temporarily locked
  • Error saving the pass

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: Get the proms from patient
name: getProms_from_patient
description: This method return the proms of an specific patient

examples.title: Example usage:

Header.description: Users unique access-key. For this, go to Get token

Parameter.description: A string with the information of the group unique id Get groupId
The patient id

Success 200.description: Returns an object with the information for one section, the list of proms associated and the answer of the patient. [{"section":(section data),"promsStructure":[{"structure":(prom generic data),"data":(patient prom answer)}]]

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
[
		{
			"section": {
    			"_id":<section_id>,
    			"description":<section description>,
    			"name":<section name>,
    			"enabled":true,
	   			"order":2
			},
			"promsStructure": {
				"structure": {
					"_id" : <prom id>,
					"relatedTo" : <prom id related>,
					"width" : "12",
					"periodicity" : 1,
					"order" : 2,
					"section" : <section id>,
					"question" : "I don’t know",
					"responseType" : "Toogle",
					"name" : "PI don’t know",
					"enabled" : true,
					"isRequired" : false,
					"values" : [ ],
					"marginTop" : false,
					"hideQuestion" : false,
					"__v" : 0
				},
				"data": true
			}
		}
]

title: Add subscriptions to group alerts/notifications for a patient
name: addSubscriptionToGroupAlerts
description: This method adds subscriptions to group alerts/notifications for a patient

examples.title: Example usage:

Header.description: Users unique access-key. For this, go to Get token

Parameter.description: Patient unique ID. More info here: Get patientId

Success 200.description: If subscriptions to group alerts/notifications for a patient has been added correctly, it returns the message 'Patient info updated'

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
		"Patient": {
			patientName: <patientName>,
			surname: <surname>,
			birthDate: <birthDate>,
			citybirth: <citybirth>,
			provincebirth: <provincebirth>,
			countrybirth: <countrybirth>,
			street: <street>,
			postalCode: <postalCode>,
			city: <city>,
			province: <province>,
			country: <country>,
			phone1: <phone1>,
			phone2: <phone2>,
			gender: <gender>,
			siblings: <siblings>,
			parents: <parents>,
			createdBy: <user reference>,
			death: <death>,
			notes: <notes>,
			answers: <answers>,
			subscriptionToGroupAlerts:true
		}
		"message":'Patient info updated'
}

Parameter.description: Patient unique ID. More info here: Get patientId

Success 200.description: If subscriptions to group alerts/notifications for a patient has been deleted correctly, it returns the message 'Patient info updated'

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
		"Patient": {
			patientName: <patientName>,
			surname: <surname>,
			birthDate: <birthDate>,
			citybirth: <citybirth>,
			provincebirth: <provincebirth>,
			countrybirth: <countrybirth>,
			street: <street>,
			postalCode: <postalCode>,
			city: <city>,
			province: <province>,
			country: <country>,
			phone1: <phone1>,
			phone2: <phone2>,
			gender: <gender>,
			siblings: <siblings>,
			parents: <parents>,
			createdBy: <user reference>,
			death: <death>,
			notes: <notes>,
			answers: <answers>,
			subscriptionToGroupAlerts:false
		}
		"message":'Patient info updated'
}
